content:
PR #22252 adds a "+" sign for the unsubscribed streams replacing the on-hover checkmark.

Screenshots:
light-theme.jpg dark-theme.jpg

Videos:
light-theme.webm dark-theme.webm

For the dark theme:

  • I used the colors from the "mute topic" button in recent topics for the "+" sign.
  • For the disabled color (for private unsubscribed streams), I just used the regular-state color with 0.5 opacity.

For the light theme:

  • I used the 2 colors of the on-hover checkmark that is currently used for unsubscribed streams (hsl(0, 0%, 87%) and hsl(0, 0%, 72%)).
  • For the disabled color, I used hsl(0, 0%, 27%).

I wanted to get feedback for the colors used here.
One other thing I wanted to clarify was what to do with the color for the disabled "+" signs. Should they be a bit more muted than the other "+" signs?
Or if someone already has the exact color specifications for this, that would also help.

Nice!

For the disabled + color, I was thinking it should match the color of other disabled elements (e.g. checkboxes) in the settings UI. Is that the case with the design above?

Hi everyone, I'm Raymond, a product designer, and I would like to contribute to Zulip. It is my first time contributing to open source, so I would appreciate guidance on how to as a designer. Thanks.

Psst! Not sure if this is the right please to post this.

Alya Abbott said:

For the disabled + color, I was thinking it should match the color of other disabled elements (e.g. checkboxes) in the settings UI. Is that the case with the design above?

I'm not sure I understand this properly. Can you give an example of what checkbox you are referring to?
@Raghav Luthra if you logic as a non-administrator, and view the organization settings page, you'll see a bunch of checkboxes that you don't have permission to toggle.

I tried using the colors from disabled checkboxes for the disabled "+" signs.

Screenshot-2022-07-27-222852.jpg Screenshot-2022-07-27-222915.jpg

In the dark mode, it looks almost identical; And in light mode, the disabled color is a bit darker as compared to the regular one.
Hmm, that won't work then... Thoughts? Should we go with the originally proposed colors, or make some adjustments?

I feel like the contrast between the disabled and regular colors in the originally proposed dark theme should be slightly greater to match the light theme. So we could make the regular color a bit brighter or make the disabled color more muted.
Could you share a screenshot, along with the color values?

Screenshot-2022-07-27-233625.jpg Screenshot-2022-07-27-233559.jpg

  • Dark theme:

    • disabled: color: hsl(218, 14%, 33%), opacity: 0.4

    • regular: color: hsl(218, 14%, 33%)

    • hover: color:hsl(230, 11%, 67%)

  • Light theme:

    • disabled: color: hsl(0, 0%, 87%)
    • regular: color: hsl(0, 0%, 72%)
    • hover: color: hsl(0, 0%, 27%)

The only change from original is opacity: 0.5 -> 0.4 in dark mode.

Alya Abbott said:

Could you share a screenshot, along with the color values?

I only included the disabled color values in the message. Did you mean the other colors as well?
I'll let others comment as well, but looks reasonable to me...
Listing the colors for all the states would be helpful; I'm not sure I see all of them covered above.

It looks like the check marks are still in the green of the pre-2020 Zulip brand color. While we're changing these colors, this would be a good time to change the green to either

  • Zulip's current brand color, which is a purplish blue, or
  • something more neutral.
